intro: Rosa serafinii f. major, commonly known as the Serafinii rose, is a rare and ornamental hybrid rose species. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates. It features glossy, dark green foliage and has a compact growth habit. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued in horticulture and botanical gardens.
